intro: Olearia aspera, commonly known as the rough olearia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its grayish-green, hairy leaves and showy white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate salt spray and strong winds. It is often found in open vegetation and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Olearia aspera plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
